nodes.bodyText: Any benefit to moving this up to the first line of the method?  I'm thinking that we'd gain the ability to save the jsonObject even if parseJSONMember throws an exception.
Whenever update is called manually, the object will be saved if we put it update. If we move it up, it will only be called when instantiated.
No, I'm not suggesting to move it out of the method.  See my code suggestion...

Can you add this to the other two classes that were missing this constructor, too?
BoxFileUploadSession.Info
BoxWebHook.Info
I think if we move line 200 to here, then it's slightly more beneficial if the parseJSONMember call fails due to parsing exception.  At least in that case, the raw JSON is preserved.
